case_vignette: A 27-year-old man is brought into the emergency department after a car ran into him while he was riding his bike. The patient is conscious and alert. He states that his arm is in pain and he is requesting morphine. The patient's past medical history is non-contributory and he is not currently on any medications. His temperature is 97.5°F (36.4°C), blood pressure is 124/65 mmHg, pulse is 122/min, respirations are 15/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. An initial splint is placed. A radiograph is performed and physical exam is notable for the findings in Figure A when the patient is asked to extend his fingers.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The individual reports arm pain after being hit by a car while riding a bike. They deny any significant medical history or current use of medications. They specifically mention having difficulty extending their fingers and experiencing arm pain without any associated swelling or numbness. They deny any discomfort in their elbow, shoulder, hand, wrist, thumb, bicep, or tricep, only emphasizing pain in their arm. There is no mention of pain in the shoulder or elbow.
trial_0.vignette_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Ulnar nerve entrapment.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is a fracture of the radius.
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis is a fracture of the humerus bone.
